Every year it seems that things get closer. Look firstly just at the level of play in NA and you can see a huge improvement, but even in other regions lots of teams have been really stepping it up and this worlds I'd say there wasn't a huge skill gap between most of the teams (with a few exceptions). While NA is out now :( they made a much better showing than last year and I'm looking forward to a close finals (fingers crossed). A lot of people see a game where say Hai has 5 less kills than his opponent mid laner and say "Oh see? that guy's so inferior" but really at this high level play, they're all pretty close in skill and it really comes down to the champs, teams, communication, and split second decision. So while scores may vary widely I felt that very few games showed one side far and away better than the other.

NA showed up this year. Both Cloud9 and TSM represented NA well. Both went against the top favorites to win the tournament and both teams took a game off their opponents in the series they played in. Considering none of the EU teams even made it out of Groups, I believe NA proved that the region is competitive enough to play on the international stage.
If only TSM wonned...
Man if only people knew how to talk in English...
Man if only people knew how to take a joke...
Wow how surpsing the World Final is once again no "World Final". Ladies and Gentlemen , let me introduce you Asian Finals of League of Legends. Just annoying and boring.

Then what do you suggest to "fix" the problem?

NA and EU teams need to step it up.  And they have.  EU might not have made it, but C9 put up a hell of a fight against SSB, and TSM managed to take a game off SSW.  It's not a hopeless cause.

And let's not forget Alliance's perfect game against NJWS and Fnatic managing to beat out SSB during group stage.

They need to step it up ? Like in physical sports (soccer etc) its about support,funding and promotion. Asia is the number one continent for e-sport talent- support,funding and promotion. Gaming is deeply rooted in the asia culture. Where else do you see gaming internet cafe's where kids are spending hours and hours of their life. They even got hospitals for addictive gaming behaviour. Im not saying thats a positive thing. It just shows how intense the gaming culture is in Asia. 

So how fix the problem ? Well create a deeper gaming culture in na eu and so on.

I agree, but creating a "deeper gaming culture" is something that's easier said than done.

We shouldn't blame Asian teams for simply being better, even if it is due to superior e-sports infrastructure.  There's nothing unfair about that.  If we want to make it to Finals, then we should be putting in more work, not telling the Asian teams to go easy on us.
SAMSUNG WHITE!!!
